deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing.
insecure.
missing.
illegible.
not in accordance with the requirements.
missing.
of an incorrect type.

with excessive corrosion, serious deterioration or a fracture in a load bearing member of the vehicle structure within 30cm of the anchorage (where a seat belt is attached to a seat frame this will apply to all seat mounting points).

with excessive corrosion, serious deterioration or a fracture in a load bearing member of the vehicle structure within 30cm of the anchorage (where a seat belt is attached to a seat frame this will apply to all seat mounting points) and is likely to detach.
a seat belt not securely fixed to the seat or to the vehicle structure.

items.itemDescription: Locking Mechanism, Stalks, Retracting Mechanism and Fittings:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: locking mechanism of a seat belt does not secure or release as intended.
an attachment or adjustment fitting fractured, badly deteriorated or not operating effectively.
corrosion or deterioration of a flexible stalk likely to lead to failure under load.
broken flexible stalk strands
a retracting mechanism that does not retract the webbing sufficiently to remove all of the slack from the belt with the locking mechanism fastened and the seat unoccupied.
a cut or damage or fluffing or fraying, which is not sufficient to obstruct correct operation of the belt or which has not clearly weakened the webbing.
a cut or damage or fluffing or fraying or overstretching sufficient to obstruct correct operation of the belt or significantly weaken the webbing.
stitching badly frayed, insecure, incomplete or repaired.
so dirty that it is likely to soil passengers’ clothing.

items.itemDescription: Obvious signs of structural weakness in a Seat belt; fitting, guide,stalk or pivot

deficiencies.deficiencyText: such that failure is likely.

items.itemDescription: Seats with seat belts attached to them:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
with a cracked or fractured leg or frame.
load limiter or pretensioner obviously missing where fitted as original equipment.
pretensioner or a ‘folded type’ webbing load limiter obviously deployed.
missing.
deployed or disconnected.
indicates any kind of failure of the system.

items.itemDescription: Installation defect found during annual test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: any obvious installation defect found during the inspection.
evidence that original webbing has been cut and/or reworked (e.g. belts knotted, fraying or fluffing removed/sealed by burning etc.).
any part of the installation which has a sharp edge which could or is likely to cut or abrade the webbing.
a directly attached anchorage not secured by standard seat belt mounting bolts and washers as detailed in paragraph D.
an anchorage insecure.
a tubular seat frame that has been drilled for the purpose of attaching a seat belt.
a directly attached anchorage not attached to a load bearing member or without suitable reinforcement.
retro-fitted three point belt which is not mounted on a suitable structure.
tubular frame legs or tubular “H” pattern legs which have not been reinforced with buttressing and diagonal bracing, or buttressing where a floor mounted belt is fitted close to a seat leg.
belt fitted to a seat which has not been suitably reinforced or modified.
without suitable padding as detailed in paragraph L.
lower anchorages less than 320 mm apart.
in such a position that loading the belt causes the cushion to be raised or significantly compressed thus allowing the occupant to effectively move forward.
an anchorage attached to the floor without reinforcement plates of a suitable size and contour.
with load spreading washer(s) missing from anchorage bolt.
claw type seat mounting with inadequate means of securing claw.
on a seat fitted to a flat rail the bolt does not pass through the leg, rail, floor and a suitable structural member or the floor has not been suitably reinforced.
tracking for securing seats and wheelchairs insecure.
free movement for a looped belt more than 25mm at the anchorage.
upper anchorage of three point belt less than 475 mm above uncompressed seat cushion measured parallel to the seat back.
upper anchorage of three point belt(s) less than 110 mm from centre line of seat.
incorrect positioning of a lap belt or lap section of a three point belt. i.e. the belt lies across the stomach or forward of the top quarter of the thigh.
a seat belt component fitted to a seat significantly intrudes into a gangway and is likely to cause injury to a passenger.
for vehicles subject to enhanced seat belt requirements no evidence that seat belt anchorages are likely to meet the strength requirements of EC directive 76/115/EC as amended by directive 96/38/EC.

items.itemDescription: Compression Ignition Engines Statutory Visual Test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: After a maximum of six accelerations the exhaust emits smoke of a level greater than that of equivalent metered levels.
The exhaust emits excessive smoke or vapour, of any colour, to an extent likely to obscure vision.
After a maximum of six accelerations, the exhaust emits smoke of a level greater than that of equivalent metered levels.

items.itemDescription: Emission control equipment fitted by the manufacturer

deficiencies.deficiencyText: absent, or obviously defective or shows any signs of obvious tampering.

items.itemDescription: A vehicle equipped with a Diesel Particulate Filter

deficiencies.deficiencyText: shows any visible signs of smoke.
inoperative or indicating a malfunction.

items.itemDescription: Compression Ignition Engines Statutory Smoke Meter Test:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles registered prior to 1 July 2008: 2.5m for non-turbocharged engines or the level specified on the manufacturer's plate, whichever is lower.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles registered prior to 1 July 2008: 3.0m for turbocharged engines or the level specified on the manufacturer's plate, whichever is lower.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than: For vehicles first registered from 1 July 2008: 1.5m for all diesel engines or the level specified on the manufacturer's plate, whichever is lower.

After a total of six accelerations have been completed, the average smoke opacity recorded for accelerations 4, 5 and 6 is more than:  For vehicles first registered from 1 January 2014: 0.7m for all diesel engines or the level specified on the manufacturer's plate, whichever is lower.
The exhaust emits excessive smoke or vapour of any colour, to an extent likely to obscure vision.
The engine is idling at a speed clearly above the normal idling speed.
The exhaust emits dense blue or clearly visible black smoke for a continuous period of 5 seconds at idling speed.

items.itemDescription: Spark Ignition Engines Exhaust Gas Analyser Check:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: HC content greater than: 1200ppm for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1975 to 1 August 1994.
HC content greater than: 200ppm for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994.
CO content greater than: 4.5% for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1975 to 31 July 1986.
CO content greater than: 3.5% for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1986 to 1 August 1994 and any LPG/CNG fuelled vehicles used from 1 August 1975.
CO content greater than: 0.2% at fast idle (2500 - 3000 rpm) for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994
CO content greater than: 0.3% at idle (450  - 1500 rpm) for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994
Lambda not between: 0.97 and 1.03 for a vehicle first used from 1 August 1994

items.itemDescription: Emission control equipment fitted by the manufacturer

deficiencies.deficiencyText: absent, or obviously defective or shows any signs of obvious tampering.

items.itemDescription: A vehicle equipped with a Diesel Particulate Filter

deficiencies.deficiencyText: shows any visible signs of smoke.
inoperative or indicating a malfunction.
fractured.
butting causing the flange to lift more than 1.5mm from the rim.
with any visible elongation of a stud hole.
with any visible elongation of a stud hole where secure fixing of a wheel is affected.
badly damaged or distorted (including damaged by the corners of a wheel nut cutting into the material of the wheel).
badly damaged or distorted (including damaged by the corners of a wheel nut cutting into the material of the wheel) where secure fixing of the wheel is affected.
not compatible with its fixings.
cracked (except at the bridge over the valve), weld breaking away or an inadequate repair.
made of aluminium alloy repaired by welding.
with a load rating less than that required to support the maximum permissible (GB) axle load.
cracked, badly damaged, or with a half shaft bolt, stud or nut loose or missing.
cracked, badly damaged, or with a half shaft bolt, stud or nut loose or missing where secure fixing of the wheel is affected.
with clearance between a spigot mounted wheel and the hub spigots that exceeds 3mm across the diameter.
with a wheel retaining nut or stud missing or loose or obviously not fulfilling the function of clamping the wheel to the hub.
with multiple wheel retaining nuts or studs missing or loose or obviously not fulfilling the function of clamping the wheel to the hub.
with a spigot wheel nut washer cracked.
with a wheel locating spigot or dowel missing.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the plated axle weight.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the plated axle weight and is loaded in excess of the tyre load index/ply rating.
which has a tyre use marking inappropriate for the type of axle or vehicle to which it is fitted.
of a different nominal size to another on the same axle.
of a different structure to another on the same axle.
on a steerable axle which is not of the same structure as any other tyre on any steerable axle
on a driven axle which is not of the same structure as any other tyre on any driven axle.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the axle weight.
of which the nominal size, ply rating, load index or speed rating of any tyre is below that appropriate for the axle weight and is loaded in excess of the tyre load index/ply rating.

items.itemDescription: A Tyre: On a two axle motor vehicle fitted with single tyres on both axles

deficiencies.deficiencyText: a combination of tyres with structures which are not shown as acceptable in the table.
with a cut which is deep enough to reach the ply or cords, and is more than 25mm long, or 10% of the section width, whichever is greater.
with a lump, bulge or tear caused by separation or partial failure of its structure, including any lifting of the tread rubber.
with exposed ply or cord.
rubbing on any part of the vehicle.
fouling on any part of the vehicle and safe driving not impaired.
fouling on any part of the vehicle and safe driving is impaired.
incorrectly seated on its wheel.
obviously underinflated.
where the base of any groove of the original tread pattern is not clearly visible.
where the minimum tread depth and tread band requirements are not met.
fitted to a vehicle which should not have one.
on which the wholly or partly recut tread pattern is not to the manufacturer’s recut tread pattern.

items.itemDescription: A bumper bar or bracket which is:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
insecure to the extent that detachment is imminent.
has a jagged or projecting edge likely to cause injury.

imDescription: Sideguards, Rear Under-Run Devices & Bumper Bars

items.itemDescription: A bumper bar or bracket which is:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
insecure to the extent that detachment is imminent.
has a jagged or projecting edge likely to cause injury.
to a vehicle required to have them fitted.
insecure.
insecure to the extent that detachment is imminent.
cracked, fractured, corroded or damaged so that its effectiveness is reduced.
with exposed surfaces which are not smooth (e.g. projecting brackets, jagged edges, bolt heads that are not dome shaped).
with external corners or edges that are sharp.
with incorrect dimensions.
that is not continuous along the vehicle length in other than accepted circumstances.
that increases the overall width of the vehicle.
with more than 550mm height from the ground to the lowest edge of the guard. (vehicle unladen or semi-trailer load platform horizontal).
not fitted to a vehicle required to have one fitted.
insecure.
insecure to the extent that detachment is imminent.
cracked, fractured, corroded or damaged so that its effectiveness is reduced.
that has a jagged edge.
with more than 550mm ground clearance (unladen).
which extends beyond the outer edge of the outermost rear tyre (see note in proceedure and standards).
with the outer end of the device more than 100mm inboard of the outer edge of the outermost rear tyre (or more than 300mm inboard where a demountable body is fitted).
extends beyond the outermost width of the vehicle which is fitted with a tail lift.
incomplete.
so insecure or positioned that it is likely to fall from the vehicle.
insecure or incorrectly positioned but not so that it is likely to fall from the vehicle.
so insecure or positioned that it is likely to fall from the vehicle or cause damage to the electrical wiring, other vehicle components or passenger luggage, or is likely to injure occupants.
not in proper condition.
insecure, damaged or incorrectly positioned but not so that either is likely to fall from the vehicle.
so insecure, damaged or positioned that it is likely to fall from the vehicle.

items.itemDescription: A drawing hitch, bar, hook, eye, ball or ball socket; or a fifth wheel king pin and its mounting or a turntable which:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: is excessively worn.
is excessively worn with obvious risk of detachment
is seriously deformed or modified impairing its effectiveness and or weakens the component (no trailer attached).
is seriously deformed or modified impairing its effectiveness and or weakens the component (trailer attached).
is cracked or fractured (no trailer attached).
is cracked or fractured (trailer attached).
is insecure.
is insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
has excessive movement between the vehicle and trailer.
has a turntable which has no clearance between mating surfaces, i.e. evidence of contact between the surfaces.
has a missing, damaged, seized and or inadequate safety or locking device or any coupling indicator inoperative.
has a coupling too weak.
insecurity between the fifth wheel and its mounting subframe and or chassis.
insecurity between the fifth wheel and its mounting subframe and or chassis to such an extent that detachment is likely.
a mandatory bolt loose or missing.
mandatory bolts loose or missing to such an extent that detachment is likely.
jaws excessively worn or out of adjustment.
jaws so worn or out of adjustment that the trailer kingpin would not be securely held.
a safety locking device is missing or inoperative.
an articulating bracket or pivot excessively worn or insecure.
an articulating bracket or pivot excessively worn or insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
any crack in a load bearing member.
an operating member insecure or worn to such an extent the coupling is unsafe.

items.itemDescription: Articulated buses - Coupling articulating bracket, operating member or safety device:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
excessively worn.
excessively worn with obvious risk of detachment.
load bearing member cracked or fractured (no trailer attached).
load bearing member cracked or fractured (trailer attached).
insecure.
insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
so damaged or deteriorated that injury to passengers or other persons is likely.
insecure.
insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
covering in such a condition that it could cause slipping or tripping.

items.itemDescription: Buses fitted with a trailer coupling - A drawing hitch, bar, hook, eye, ball or ball socket:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: excessively worn.
excessively worn with obvious risk of detachment.
seriously deformed or modified impairing its effectiveness and or weakens the component (no trailer attcahed).
seriously deformed or modified impairing its effectiveness and or weakens the component (trailer attcahed).
cracked or fractured (no trailer attached).
cracked or fractured (trailer attached).
insecure.
is insecure to such an extent that detachment is likely.
has a missing, damaged, inoperative and or inadequate safety or locking device or any coupling indicator inoperative.

items.itemDescription: Any mechanical coupling or towing device with:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: an unsafe modification to it secondary parts.
an unsafe modification to it primary parts.

imDescription: Trailer Parking and Emergency Brakes and Air Line Connections

deficiencies.deficiencyText: does not operate on at least two wheels.
cannot be securely set.
mechanism worn.
mechanism insecure, cracked, excessively worn or badly corroded.
when fully applied the mechanism is at the end of its working travel or it is fouling adjacent parts of the vehicle.
not applied automatically when the emergency brake line is disconnected.

deficiencies.deficiencyText: not fitted in service line.
produces incorrect amount of lift.
fitted with a manual shut off tap.
insecure, inadequately mounted or defective.
insecure, inadequately mounted or defective to such an extent the functionality is affected.

items.itemDescription: A landing leg or any component part

deficiencies.deficiencyText: so insecure that it is likely to fall from the vehicle.

imDescription: Spray Suppression, Wings and Wheel Arches

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing or so badly corroded or distorted to stop it acting as an adequate shield or in the case of a mud flap fitted as a wing, it is not restrained or constructed to stop wind lift.
so badly corroded or distorted or so insecure that it can fall off or rub on the tyre.
that has sharp edges that are likely to cause injury.
which is rubbing on a tyre.
which does not cover the whole width of a tyre when the wheel is in the straight ahead position.
insecure to such an extent it is likely to drop off.
not fitted where required.
insufficient coverage of tread.
incomplete or seriously defective.
dimensions do not comply with requirements.
with a wheel flap not restrained or stiff enough to stop excessive movement or wind lift in normal use.
with more than 25% of the minimum required wheel flap or spray suppression material area clogged with mud or debris.
missing or so badly corroded or distorted to stop it acting as an adequate shield.
so badly corroded or distorted or so insecure that it can fall off or rub on the tyre.
that has sharp edges that are likely to cause injury.
which is rubbing on a tyre.
which does not cover the whole width of a tyre when the wheel is in the straight ahead position.
insecure but not affecting the stability of the vehicle.
with any insecurity that is likely to affect the stability of the vehicle.
retention and/or locking device on a tilt cab missing or defective.
retention and/or locking device on a tilt cab missing and or defective to such an extent that it seriously effects road safety.
obviously not located squarely on chassis and which obviously affects safe control of the vehicle.
with excessive corrosion or damage to a load bearing member which seriously reduces its strength within 30cm of the cab mountings.
with excessive corrosion or damage to a load bearing member which seriously reduces its strength within 30cm of the cab mountings and stability is obviously affected.
is missing.
cannot be opened.
has a sliding action and it will not remain closed or is likely to fly open inadvertently.
has a hinged action and it will not remain closed or is likely to fly open inadvertently.

imDescription: Passenger Doors, Driver Doors and Emergency Exits

deficiencies.deficiencyText: incomplete or missing.
cannot be opened to its fullest extent.
with a sliding action which will not remain closed or is likely to fly open inadvertently or will not open without undue effort.
with a hinged action which will not remain closed or is likely to fly open inadvertently.
with a missing/defective device for holding a door, or on a Bus Directive or ECE vehicle, a door or top hinged emergency window, open.
with insecure, excessively worn or fractured hinges or pins or insecure door pillars which could adversely affect operation.
with insecure, excessively worn or fractured hinges or pins or insecure door pillars which could adversely affect operation and is likely to cause an injury.
with a supplementary locking device which cannot be overridden by all the associated interior door controls.
with a release handle guard insecure or missing.
“open” warning device missing or inoperative.
a break glass window fitted with laminated glass or other unbreakable glazing.

items.itemDescription: A door or emergency exit opening or closing mechanism:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: defective, excessively worn or damaged so that it is difficult to open or close the door or exit.
control button(s) loose, sticking or with excessive movement before operating.

items.itemDescription: A door and emergency exit marking:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: missing.
method of operation not shown (not applicable to Schedule 6 apart from the emergency door).

items.itemDescription: Power operated doors and emergency exits:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: repeated operations of the doors depletes the braking system(s) pressure below the level at which the circuit protection valve should operate.
cannot be opened from inside or outside the vehicle using the emergency controls.
soft edge missing, deteriorated or damaged so that injury could be caused to any person.
safety system does not operate correctly.
opens or closes suddenly or with excessive force and is likely to injure persons outside the vehicle.
with an opening tool or device missing or not secured in a readily accessible place.
the operation of an automatically operated service door.

items.itemDescription: A cab floor or internal wheel arch:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: which is badly deteriorated or insecure.
which is so badly deteriorated or insecure that it would impair the drivers control of the vehicle or is likely to cause injury.
insecure.
so insecure or in such a condition it is likely to cause injury.

items.itemDescription: A cab floor or internal wheel arch in the driver's area which:

deficiencies.deficiencyText: is badly deteriorated or insecure.
is so badly deteriorated or insecure it is likely to impair the driver's control of the vehicle or is likely to cause injury..

deficiencies.deficiencyText: insecure.
which is so insecure or in such a condition it is likely to cause injury.
not provided.
cannot be opened.
structure defective.
